comments.text:
Codie … 
I’ve felt like this rat swimming for survival my entire life. I want some help.
I deserve your time because I believe I am capable of doing amazing things with the right tools and education . I also want to take what I learn and pay it forward to other people so they can benefit from it as well..
That said, would you take me under your wing and mentor me?
Time is your most valuable resource and I give you my word as a man that I won’t waste, or take for granted a single second of your time you decide to give me.
comments.author: @PhilAzMan

comments.text: What Codie’s talking about isn’t just moving quickly; it’s moving with a clear direction first. Momentum doesn’t come from frantic motion, it comes from focused execution with purpose. When you know exactly what you want and why it matters, every step you take compounds instead of dissipating into noise. That’s what turns action into progress and ideas into results.

comments.text:
what happened after 60 hours? I think they drowned else scientists have put them in water for long er hours.
so conclusion- First group of rats were tortured for 15 minutes but rats who kept trying were tortured more, extremely more with noting to gain, no success.
 Moral- Know your limitations, learn about the environment you are in, take decision accordingly, do not put all your eggs in one basket.
